txt.en: 'I will return when Aragorn has regained his throne! I promise!'
'We will return those relics to their proper places, but first I have other business here.'
'Gwindeth!'
'I know you are there! Gwindeth, come forth!'
'Why has [placeholder] brought me? Gwindeth, it was my idea to....'
'That is why we have come!'
'It has been made known to us that Aragorn has need of the Dúnedain.'
'I will ride to him in Rohan. It is my duty.'
'I care not, Gwindeth! All my concerns are for...those I leave behind.'
'My curiosity demanded I show myself, Dúnadan. Nothing more.'
'I wish to know why [placeholder] has brought you to this place.'
'It has been long since you came to my grotto, [placeholder].'
'You were then the messenger of Aragorn son of Arathorn. You and he have dwelt in my thoughts ever since.'
'There will be trials upon the road. It is a long way to that land.'
'Such concerns are a weakness in Man.'
'Calenglad.'
'Short are the lives of Men, even those of the Dúnedain.'
'But I mourned not for a season, nor for a single span of years.'
'Even proud Elendil came in the end to death, and I mourned his passing.'
'My grief will last for many lifetimes.'
'The coins of Angmar are wasted if this is the quality of wretches they buy!'
'And so it is I give my love to that which can outlast the lifetime of a single Man.'
'Still, if the Rangers leave for the south-lands, even the weak will seem mighty if unopposed.'
'Men may die, Calenglad. Indeed, I see death upon your road.'
'More robbers approach!'

'You must think me an old fool, [placeholder]. There is no protection I can offer Gwindeth that she cannot manage for herself. Still it is difficult to leave behind people and places we hold dear.\n\n'I did not want to leave without saying good-bye. I have now done so, but it does not make the leaving any easier.'
'Let us leave this place, [placeholder]. The air has grown chill of a sudden, and I am ready to return to Tinnudir.'
'But if through your actions Aragorn takes his throne, a kingdom shall return that should never have ended.'

'We have arrived, [placeholder]. This section of the city suffered greatly in the battle against Amarthiel's forces, and robbers have come from the surrounding lands in order to plunder it of goods.

'The tree-lined streets of this ward were quite beautiful before the fighting, deserted though they were. Now the walls are cracked and many of the buildings and tombs that are found here have been flooded, or are flooding.

'Let us save what relics we may from the undeserving pockets of robbers, [placeholder].'
'And is that not worth some measure of sorrow?'

'There are more robbers inside this tomb, [placeholder]. Clear them out and recover whatever relics they have already stolen. While you see to that, I will investigate some of these other buildings. I will meet up with you again once the tomb is clear of these villains.'
'Farewell, Calenglad. Nenuial will remember you.'
Calenglad has been defeated
Calenglad has been defeated
You have defeated the tomb-robbers and should now examine their plunder
'[placeholder] is a friend of Aragorn, my chieftain, charged with mustering the Dúnedain that they may aid him.'
Inside the chest you see many relics stolen from Annúminas
Gwindeth favours you with a distant smile, brought on by some fond memory
You have come with Calenglad to the Flooded Ward to clear it of robbers so that his heart may rest easy as he travels with the Grey Company.
'They fall!'
'Let us keep moving. I am not content to leave robbers within this city.'
Talk to Calenglad
Clear the Flooded Ward of robbers with Calenglad
Talk to Calenglad
Clear the tomb of robbers while Calenglad searches the streets outside
Investigate the tomb-robbers' plunder
'Watch your step upon the stairs.'
Wait until Calenglad is satisfied that he can join the Grey Company
'Do you hear that? Voices from the tomb ahead. Ready yourself for battle!'
'Good fortune within the crypt, [placeholder]. There are many robbers within.'
Talk to Calenglad at Tinnudir
'Let us clear this ward of robbers, [placeholder].'
'The False King has been defeated, but followers of Angmar still remain in Annúminas.'
'The coffers of Carn Dûm are emptied, and those riches have bought the loyalty of these robbers.'
'Too many relics have already been wrested from this once proud city. From my city!'
'There they are, [placeholder].'
'For Annúminas and Nenuial!'
'They are no match. Would that all allies of Angmar were so frail!'
'The fighting against Amarthiel's forces took a grave toll on this part of the city, [placeholder].'
'Farewell, Calenglad and [placeholder]. Nenuial will remember you both.'
Calenglad is in the Flooded Ward of Annúminas.
'Annúminas has stood empty for most of the age, but the Dúnedain have always watched over it.'
'It did not always look thus.'
Calenglad is standing in front of a tomb-entrance in the Flooded Ward.
'Can we really abandon it again? Is it wise to travel to the south-lands?'
'Up these steps. The hired hands of Angmar came from this way.'
The robbers have put their gathered plunder into a strongbox located within the crypt.
'Let us proceed, [placeholder].'
Calenglad is speaking with Gwindeth, the Blue Lady of Nenuial.
Calenglad is inside the crypt in the Flooded Ward, waiting to speak with you.
'Search the crypt for the robbers' plunder, [placeholder]. They will have gathered it into a strongbox.'
'Who is this [placeholder] you bring before me, Calenglad?'
'What dangers can have befallen the son of Arathorn that such help is necessary?'
Instance: Farewell to Evendim
'Has the time come at last for the king to assume his throne?'
'Is that all you have to say to me?'
'Have I not spent a lifetime....'
'I...I do not know, Gwindeth.'
'Very good, [placeholder].'
